posts.post_content:
Absolutely amazing. It has a good body for its cost and excellent types.   
  
Oh yeah, I forgot his EPIC ability.   
  
Combined with a Necrotic ooze neither of them will stay in the graveyard for long, and that is only the simplest of possibilities. The combinations this guy will create, not to mention his card advantage generation, will make him a very fearsome threat and a must kill in any deck he appears in. I'm looking forward to running him in EDH, where the recasting aspect will truly shine.   
  
Overall, this guy is amazing, truly worthy of mythic status and something whose potential has barely been figured out yet. He will probably be a powerhouse.

posts.post_content:
Nabbed one at the prerelease, and good lord. The sheer POWER of this thing cannot be overstated. The ability to recur a chump blocker (like say, [Typhoid Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Typhoid Rats)) over and over is amazing already. Doing it with ETB creatures or anything with Undying? This thing isn't just a lich, it's the best "necromancer" creature card I've ever seen.  
  
Although he had a habit of getting murdered by my [Reaper of the Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper of the Abyss) (I was a lucky boy this morning) over and over. That thing's ability isn't a "may" effect!

Posted By: Nucleon (1/28/2012 6:42:53 PM)
Rating:

@am208g
@BioPrince

no, this card does not "overwrite the rules". no card does anything more than what is stated. all cards tell you exactly what you can do, within the confines of all other rules.

Havengul Lich does NOT allow you to cast non-flash creatures at instant speed. it allows you to cast creatures "from a graveyard". thats ALL it does (plus the ability-gaining). any other rules that are not stated to be replaced or changed (i.e. casting cost, and timing) remain the same.

with that said, it's still a fairly cool card, though i doubt it will see much play in constructed. edh, on the other hand, LOOOOVES this guy

posts.post_content:
Absotively Posolutely beautiful. Never has a more accessible, yet controlled, and combo-prone repeatable reanimation tactic been printed. He's what [Sedris the Traitor King](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sedris the Traitor King) could have been were the "or whenever it dies" clause not included in the Unearth ability.   
  
[Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning)  
  
[Great Whale](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Great Whale)  
  
[Phyrexian Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Altar)  
  
[Warstorm Surge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warstorm Surge)  
  
With the optional safety net of [Rune-Scarred Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rune-Scarred Demon).   
  
The most diverse, balanced, and fun card in the set.

Posted By: heavyterror (2/1/2012 11:02:59 PM)

posts.post_content:
It will be quite good in a proper constructed or EDH deck but in limited its hosed down by 1 low costing card in this set  
  
[Grafdigger's Cage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafdigger's Cage) turns this creature into a mythic 5 mana 4/4 vanilla until you can get rid of it. And having to use his ability only on creatures you can cast (no stealing off colour stuff) and on your turn (ability does not state creature card has flash) means great planning must be done to get full use from this.  
  
On the other hand, I have seen it do wonderful things. Undying cards a lot harder to deal with even if the Lich cannot gain any abilities, as your undying cards can come back for just 1 extra colourless in addition to the cast cost

Posted By: StarOutlaw (1/29/2012 11:49:40 PM)

posts.post_content: Something to note: Once the creature brought back from the grave is put back there, **It is still targeted by the ability.** In other words, you don't have to play that extra 1 mana again if you want to play the creature again. So, in other words, the [Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning) + [Perilous Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perilous Myr) + Lich combo is infinite damage, since you can continuously cast it without having to pay that 1 every time you wish to do so. Congratulations, Wizards. You created a turn 4 infinite damage combo in standard.
posts.html:
